thread.title: Man fighting for life in hospital after stabbing - Manchester Evening News
thread.title_full: Man fighting for life in hospital after stabbing - Manchester Evening News

author: Sam Yarwood
title: Man fighting for life in hospital after stabbing - Manchester Evening News
text:
News Man fighting for life in hospital after stabbing A man, aged in his 30s, was discovered with a stab wound in Openshaw and has been taken to hospital with a shoulder injury Share Police were called to Old Lane in Openshaw (Photo: Steve Allen) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A man is fighting for his life in hospital following a stabbing in Openshaw . 
Police and paramedics were called to Old Lane shortly after 9am on Friday, February 2. 
A man, aged in his 30s, was discovered with a stab wound and has been taken to hospital with a shoulder injury. 
Police says he remains in hospital in a serious condition. 
A 41-year-old woman has been arrested on suspicion of section 18 assault and remains in police custody for questioning. Read More 
Detectives have taped off Old Lane and police remain at the scene. 
Witnesses said forensic officers could be seen searching bins in the road. 
A spokesman for the North West Ambulance Service said: “We were called at 9.01am. 
“We have taken a man to Manchester Royal Infirmary. 
“He has got injuries to his shoulder.” 
Anyone with information should contact police on 101 quoting reference number 497 of 03/02/17 or the independent charity Crimestoppers, anonymously, on 0800 555 111. Like us on Facebook
